body_html:
Smart pointers are used in various parts of the TensorFlow codebase (e.g. unique_ptr), albeit not in every place.

We encourage the use of such pointers where it makes sense - whether in new code or when making changes to existing code. I do not think, however, that there is a particularly pressing need to comb through the whole code base to switch to smart pointers everywhere.

If you have a particular scenario that leads to unsafe pointer dereferences, please feel free to file a specific issue or send a pull request. Thanks very much

body:
Smart pointers are used in various parts of the TensorFlow codebase ([e.g. `unique_ptr`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=std%3A%3Aunique_ptr&type=)), albeit not in every place.

We encourage the use of such pointers where it makes sense - whether in new code or when making changes to existing code. I do not think, however, that there is a particularly pressing need to comb through the whole code base to switch to smart pointers everywhere.

If you have a particular scenario that leads to unsafe pointer dereferences, please feel free to file a specific issue or send a pull request. Thanks very much
